bioghist.head: Biographial note
bioghist.p: John Dikeman, judge and lawyer, helped found and taught in a Sunday School for African-Americans in the village of Brooklyn (circa 1815). He also taught in School District No. 1 in Brooklyn. In 1824, he served as a clerk to the trustees of the village. Dikeman was one of the lessees with the New York and Brooklyn Ferry Co. (1839). In 1867, he was vice-president of the Kings County Inebriates' Home, of which Frothingham was president.
